result.execSummary:
The defendant Kylon K Owens was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Firearm-Convicted of a Felony, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
-Sentence credit of 74 days is granted if revoked. 
-Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program. 
-Defendant is not eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.
-Probation may be transferred to Wisconsin Rapids/Wood County.

miscConds.notes:
-Cash bail applied to costs. Balance to be paid as a condition of probation. 
-Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff 
Department.

-Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any assessments, evaluations, treatment, and/or counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. Valid prescriptions only with prior agent approval and to be taken only in the manner they are prescribed. 
-No use or possession of CBD Products.

-Full-Time employment and/or combination of schooling. 
-No dangerous Weapons. 
**Firearm is to be forfeited to the Waukesha Co Sheriff's Department. 
-If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

timeConds.notes:
-Huber. 
-Sentence commencing on 11-11-2022 by 5:00pm. Sentence  may be served in Wood County.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kylon K Owens

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt:
Case called at 11:00 a.m.
Intern Julian Marrufo in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Attorney James Edgar Toran in court for Kylon K Owens. 
Defendant Kylon K Owens in court.
Defendant's father in court.
State makes sentencing recommendations.
Defendant's father makes statements.
Defense makes sentencing recommendations.
 
COUNT 1
Court orders the following:
Total Prison: 4 1/2 YEARS 
Initial Confinement:  18 MONTHS
Extended Supervision:  3 YEARS
74-Days Credit, if Revoked

Defendant is eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program, after he serves 6 months.
Defendant is not eligible for Substance Abuse Program.  
SENTENCE IS STAYED.

Term of Probation:  3 YEARS
Probation may be transferred to Wisconsin Rapids/Wood County.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended
Absolute Sobriety, Random U.A.'s
No Use of Possession of alcohol or controlled substances w/o valid RX, or drug paraphernalia
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed
Inform Agent of all prescriptions
No use/possession of CBD products
Follow through with any assessment, evaluation, treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent
Full-Time employment and/or combination of schooling
No Dangerous Weapons (e.g. Knives, firearms, etc.)

Firearm is to be forfeited to the Waukesha County Sheriff's Department.

COSTS:  $268.00
DNA SAMPLE AND SURCHARGE:  $250.00 
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
To be paid as a Condition of Probation.

CONDITION TIME: 45-DAYS HUBER. 
Sentence may be served in Wood County.
Sentence to commence on 11-11-2022 by 5:00 p.m.

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.
Body Armour warnings given.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Abigail Kincheloe and ADA Andrew Nesheim. 
Defendant Kylon K Owens in court.  Attorney James Edgar Toran in court for Kylon K Owens. 

Defendant enters a plea of Guilty to the charge.
Court finds the defendant Guilty of the charge.

FELONY WARNING PROVIDED:  REGARDING VOTING AND FIREARMS RESTRICTIONS.

At the time of sentencing the state will be requesting forfeiture of the firearm
Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 7, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Sentencing hearing on October 7, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 19, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Case called at 9:59 AM
Charles Patrick Hoffmann appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney James Edgar Toran in court by zoom.   Defendant Kylon K Owens did not appear. 
All parties have agreed that some may have the hearing conducted remotely. This hearing has met the statutory standards for video conferencing. 
State requests a Capias.  
Defense requests that the case be set for plea/sentence and he will get in contact with him.
Court grants.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 19, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Hearing on July 8, 2022 at 09:00 am.

09:39 AM Andrew Nesheim appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Kylon K Owens in court by zoom video with attorney James Edgar Toran, in person.  File not called on the record.  Attorney Toran states his client was just released from custody and they are still awaiting an offer.  State to provide an offer to defense prior to the next date.  Court sets a status date in about 30 days.  Parties may appear by zoom for the next date.  Hearing scheduled for July 8, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Detainer Lift sent to:  Waupaca County Jail  
**sent via fax on 05-11-2022, with confirmation of successful fax transmission (mjs)

Prior: 1402 Royalton St, c/o Waupaca County Jail, Waupaca, WI 54981 United States
returned from Waupaca County Jail via email
Hearing on June 3, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Search Warrant
Endorsement of Warrant
Return of Officer
Affidavit
Defendant waives his right to a Preliminary Hearing.

09:23 AM Lindsey Hirt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Kylon K Owens in court, in custody, with attorney Charles Collier for attorney James Edgar Toran. Defendant Kylon K Owens in court, in custody, with attorney James Edgar Toran.  The Court finds that the Defendants waiver to a preliminary hearing is knowing and voluntary.  Waive reading of Information.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Bail remains as fixed.  Defendant to be returned forthwith to Waupaca County Jail.  Clerk's office to set up video appearance from Waupaca County Jail for the next date.  Hearing scheduled for June 3, 2022 at 10:00 am.
FAX CONFIRMATION FROM WAUPACA COUNTY JAIL.
Preliminary hearing on April 4, 2022 at 09:15 am.
Detainer placed at: WAUPACA COUNTY JAIL
filed, to be produced from WAUPACA COUNTY JAIL
Defendant is not to possess any dangerous weapons/firearms.

02:33 PM Defendant Kylon K Owens appeared by Zoom, in custody at Waupaca County Jail, with attorney James Edgar Toran who appeared by Zoom.   Christian Farina appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   All parties have agreed that some may have the hearing conducted remotely. This hearing has met the statutory standards for video conferencing.

Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  
Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.
Preliminary Hearing requested.  Preliminary time limits waived.
THE COURT ORDERS THE DEFENDANT BE PRODUCE FROM WAUPACA COUNTY JAIL FOR THE NEXT COURT DATE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 4, 2022 at 09:15 am.
Initial appearance on February 24, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Kylon K Owens
Current: 1402 Royalton St, c/o Waupaca County Jail, Waupaca, WI 54981 United States  (Effective: 01-27-2022)
Prior: 5810 73Rd St S, Wisconsin Rapids, WI 54494
Initial appearance on February 24, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

08:55 AM Attorney James Edgar Toran appeared by Zoom.   Defendant Kylon K Owens did not appear.   Christian Farina appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Attorney Toran states that the Defendant is in custody at the Waukesha County Jail.
However, the Sheriff's Deputy states he is not in in custody at our jail.
The Court further investiagtes and states that it can not find the Defendant in custody. 
The State does not object to an adjournment.
Attorney Toran does not object.
Court ordered a $5,000.00 warrant stayed until next court date.  EXT CODE 1.
The Court will adjourn.
THE COURT WILL APPROVE ATTORNEY TORAN APPEARANCE BY ZOOM ONLY.  THE DEFENDANT MUST APPEAR IN PERSON. 

The Court recalls the matter at 09:35 AM with the same appearances.
Attorney Toran states his client is currently incarcerated at Waupaca County Jail.
The court will set the initial appearance over on CT Video day.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.
